stories.text: Can anyone comment on whether or not it makes sense to work as a US cofounder on a company based in China? Is it even doable? Do Chinese cofounders even want to work with US partners?
stories.title: Ask HN: Partnering with Chinese cofounders as a US citizen?

stories.text:
I work in a large infra organization at one of the big tech companies. I like almost everything about my job and I feel like the infra space is right for me.

But one thing I really don't like is the social situation. Pretty much everyone in the org has a family and/or isn't interested in the social aspect of work. They are all personable and kind, but they aren't there to socialize -- it's just their job.

As someone who doesn't have a family and is only a couple of years out of college, this lack of socialization has been pretty tough. I wonder if it's this way everywhere or if big tech infra just attracts people who are working for the money, not for the whole experience like I think I am.

So I wonder: if you work in infra, does this resonate with you? How do you deal with it (or do you)?
stories.title: Ask HN: If you work in infra, how's the social situation?
